result.execSummary:
The defendant Kalen Abe Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: copy of District Attorney's office letter to dispatch canceling warrant.   Filed by ADA Crystal Long.
Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken

Defendant, Kalen Abe Larson, appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the right to an attorney. Defendant waived attorney. Rights & elements recited. Defendant plead no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 5 days jail starting Sept. 9, 2016 at 7 p.m., may transfer to Adams Cty. Jail. Huber granted pursuant to WI. Stat. 303.08. $443 costs, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Submit DNA sample. No jail credit.

Defendant, Kalen Abe Larson, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appearing on warrant, quashed, defendant to go to Br. 3 JA for further scheduling, all previous conditions of bond continue, bond reinstated,
for failure to appear at the 6/10/16 Final Pretrial Conference

Defendant Kalen Abe Larson not in Court.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failed to appear for the final pretrial.  State requested a warrant.  Warrant authorized forthwith.
Pre-trial conference on June 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on July 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Kalen Abe Larson, appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant would like counsel, not agreeing w/offer, not guilty pleas entered, matter to be set for jury trial Br. 3

Defendant, Kalen Abe Larson, appeared. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $200.00 signature bond.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Standard misd. conditions.  Previously posted bond will be returned.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:50 pm.  Return date scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
